Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a picture of a healthy plant that has water and light.
The student can draw a picture of a plant without water and describe how it looks different from a healthy plant.
The student can draw a picture of a plant without light and describe how it looks different from a healthy plant.
The student can identify patterns from their drawings, showing that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
The student can use their drawings to explain that just like plants need light and water, animals (including humans) need food and water to live.
